Description: Schedule Initial Status Meeting and alert personnel
Content: Organize an immediate meeting with all key stakeholders, including upper management and relevant department heads, to discuss the current situation, share initial findings, and outline next steps.

Description: Identify which systems/applications are being targeted
Content: Analyze logs and network traffic to determine affected systems and applications, prioritizing critical assets.

Description: Contact ISP - ask for assistance in blocking traffic
Content: Coordinate with the ISP to block malicious traffic and discuss possible mitigation strategies.

Description: Identify worst business impact if unable to mitigate DDoS
Content: Assess potential consequences, such as financial losses or reputational damage, if the DDoS attack cannot be mitigated, and services remain unavailable.
Separate internal web traffic from affected services to reduce impact
Notify the appropriate law enforcement agency about the DoS attack, providing relevant details and requesting assistance if needed.
Blacklist IP addresses used by the attacker

Description: Inform stakeholders of the progress of containment activities in accordance with the CIRP.
Content: Regularly update internal and external stakeholders on the status of the incident, ongoing mitigation efforts, and potential impacts.

Description: Consider initiating Business Continuity Plan (BCP) if the incident is likely to have a significant impact on the business.
Content: Assess the severity of the incident and activate the BCP if necessary to maintain essential business functions during and after the DDoS attack.
